Current driver¶

class current_driver.CurrentDriver(name, port1, port2, parent=None, labjack=None)¶

Bases: emergent.archetypes.node.Device, emergent.archetypes.parallel.ProcessHandler

Current driver for quadrupole coils using two TDK Genesys programmable power supplies and a bespoke current servo board.

B(z, I1, I2)¶

Analytic model for the on-axis field as a function of known calibration constants.

Parameters:
  • z (float) -- On-axis position in m.
  • I1 (float) -- Current of coil 1 in A.
  • I2 (float) -- Current of coil 2 in A.
__init__(name, port1, port2, parent=None, labjack=None)¶

Initialize the Device for use.

Parameters:
  • name (str) -- Name of Device node.
  • port1 (str) -- Serial port for the first power supply (e.g. 'COM1').
  • port2 (str) -- Serial port for the second power supply (e.g. 'COM2').
  • parent (str) -- Name of the parent Control node.
  • labjack (archetypes.labjackT7.LabJack) -- LabJack instance to use.
_actuate(state)¶

Set the current of each coil.

Parameters:state (dict) -- State dict containing target currents in amps, e.g. {'I1':50, 'I2':40}.
_connect()¶
_connect_to_psu(coil)¶

Connects to the Genesys power supply for coil 1 or 2.

calibrate(coil, Vmin=1.5, Vmax=3, steps=10, delay=0.05, plot=False)¶

Measure and fit the IV curve of the FETs.

Parameters:
  • coil (int) -- The coil to calibrate (1 or 2)
  • Vmin (float) -- Lower bound of the voltage sweep.
  • Vmax (float) -- Upper bound of the voltage sweep.
  • steps (int) -- Number of steps in the voltage sweep.
  • delay (float) -- Optional settling time between changing voltage and measuring.
  • plot (bool) -- If True, plot the calibration curve.
disable_setpoint(ch)¶

Only works with ch = 1 or 2

enable_setpoint(ch)¶

Only works with ch = 1 or 2

measure_current(coil)¶

Measure the Hall probe current.

Parameters:coil (int) -- 1 or 2
primary_to_secondary(state)¶

Converts a primary state with currents I1, I2 to a secondary state with a gradient and zero.

Parameters:state (dict) -- State dict with primary currents in amps, e.g. {'I1':50, 'I2':40}.
Returns:State dict with gradient in G/cm and zero position in mm, e.g. {'grad':50, 'zero':0}.
Return type:secondary_state (dict)
pulse(N=20, A=10, T=1)¶
secondary_to_primary(state)¶

Converts a secondary state with gradient and zero into a primary state with currents I1, I2.

Parameters:state (dict) -- State dict with gradient in G/cm and zero position in mm, e.g. {'grad':50, 'zero':0}.
Returns:State dict with primary currents in amps, e.g. {'I1':50, 'I2':40}.
Return type:primary_state (dict)
set_current(coil, current)¶

Sets the current of the targeted coil based on the IV calibration. :param coil: 1 or 2 :type coil: int :param current: target current :type current: float

set_field(grad, z0)¶

Sets coil currents to achieve the desired gradient and zero position.

Parameters:
  • gradient (float) -- Magnetic field gradient at the zero position, in G/cm.
  • z0 (float) -- offset of the zero position from the center of the coils in mm, along the axis pointing from coil 1 to coil 2.
wave(frequency=2, I1=65, I2=65)¶
wave_ttl(frequency=2)¶

Starts a wave between the current setpoint and 0
